title: The multisensory mind: From neural mechanisms to cognition
descriptions: The grant proposal, titled "The multisensory mind: From neural mechanisms to cognition," focuses on the field of multisensory integration (MI) using human EEG data, source modeling of synchronized EEG activity, and magnetic resonance spectroscopy. The objectives of the project include examining neural and neurochemical markers of MI and testing a new hypothesis regarding synchronized neural populations. The study will involve healthy subjects and patients with schizophrenia to gain insights into multisensory integration and potentially inform treatment for conditions with impaired multisensory integration. By uncovering how sensory inputs merge into coherent multisensory percepts, this research program has the potential to advance our understanding of cognition and the underlying neural mechanisms. The findings from this study could have implications for the development of interventions targeting conditions with disrupted multisensory integration. Overall, this project aims to bridge the gap between neural mechanisms and cognitive processes related to multisensory integration, ultimately contributing to the broader field of neuroscience and cognitive science.
